history.content: Current 120 student here. Midterm exams are in-class as well, and there are no makeups (which makes sense, given that the class is relatively small).
Current 120 student here. Exams are in-class as well, and there are no makeups (which makes sense, given that the class is relatively small).

children.subject: Final times will also conflict and the teacher may or may not offer an alternative time.
I took EE 120 with Babak last semester (he is also teaching it next semester), and there was no final exam - instead, we had three midterms. I would email him directly to ask, though.
Has anyone contacted/received a reply from the professors of 120 and 170 on whether taking them together would be possible?

history.content:
I'm planning on doing both CS170 and EE120 next semester even though both have the same lecture time. Is this possible? I know 170 is webcasted so watching lectures should not be an issue, but I also know that classes with same lecture times tend to have the same final time and I don't know if either of these classes offer finals at a different time. Does anyone know if this is a viable plan?

------------

Upon further research, it appears that CS170 hosts their midterms during lecture and does not offer any makeup tests (though they might allow you to take a course at the same lecture time if that course offers alternate exam times). Is anyone in 120 currently or has been in the course in the past and know about their exam policies? I can't seem to find anything online.
history.subject: How viable is it to do two classes with the same lecture time?
